meta_description: The Cuero Heritage Museum, located in the Cuero Federal Building, was the former Post Office built in 1915. The permanent and rotating exhibits showcase adventures around every corner.
accessibility_text:
| ** Guadalupe River Changes  **|   
---|---  
  
Case study: Before & After the Flood of '98. The interactive map shows changes in the Guadalupe River from 1996 to 2023. The river is very much alive and continues to change. 2023 experienced a bad drought which is very noticable in the photos. Click on the map below to bring up the interactive map. Once the map opens in a new window, at the bottom right - open layer list and click on: 60cm 2020 NAIP color imagery.   
---

collections_text:
We will be Closed on December 24 & 25 for Christmas and December 31 & January 1 for New Years. Hours: Tuesday - Saturday 10 am - 3 pm  **We are reachable by phone at 361-485-8090.** | ** Cuero Heritage Museum  **|   
---|---  
  
The Cuero Heritage Museum, located in the Cuero Federal Building, was the former Post Office built in 1915. The Museum offers many wonders and is dedicated to celebrating the people of Cuero and their unique heritage. Visit the permanent and rotating exhibits to visually explore the history of this quaint, yet fascinating town.

Numerous permanent captivating collections include, Cuero made famous by its "Gobbler Pride" and love of the hometown football team, "100 Years of Football - Gobblers & Daule". When you walk through, you may just hear, "Go Mean Green" in the background and the crowd cheering. Another permanent collection upstairs features over 3,600 delightful reamers in every shape and design you can imagine lends way to juicing in a new light. The glamorous and glittery yet infamous "Turkey Trot Exhibit" will leave you in awe, now with a lush Turkish Palace. The Coca Cola Exhibit will leave you craving a coke, and the WWII Exhibit will wow you with local heroes, and model of the Brayton Flying Field. The Martha Sawyers Exhibit, an American Illustrator, will have you ready for an adventure. Learn about the founding of Cuero and the Railroad. A fun scavenger hunt for the kids is available. 

So visit and learn why this historic Texas town in ...
